contextId.information: Because God made the promise to Abraham and they wrote it down before the promise came through Christ, the scripture is like someone who knows the future before it happens. AT: "predicted" or "saw before it happened" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
Paul is treating scripture as though it were a person and is speaking of God, who wrote scripture. AT: "God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

The sinful nature is spoken of as if it were a person and wanted to sin.  AT: "what you want to do because of your sinful nature" or "the things you want to do because you are sinful"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: the desires of the sinful nature

contextId.information: The sinful nature is spoken of as if it were a person who does things.  AT: "what people do because of their sinful nature" or "the things people do because they are sinful"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: the works of the sinful nature

contextId.information: Paul speaks of Christians who refuse to live according to their sinful nature as if it were a person and they have killed it on a cross. AT: "refuse to live according the sinful nature with its passions and desires, as if they killed it on a cross" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: have crucified the sinful nature with its passions and desires
